item.title: College
item.description: This morning, I woke up at 4:30 to drop my family off at the airport. I didn’t get much sleep last night - I wasn’t really tired until 11, and then I stayed up for another hour when the Kawhi/PG news broke. It was a 45 minute drive to the airport and too early for anyone to feel like talking much. Spent some time hugging everyone and saying goodbye, and that was it.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi, I’m Mason, a recent Duke graduate and currently an embedded systems engineer at Ayar Labs. Accomplishments include building a chess-playing robot, surviving six weeks in K-ville, and making top 10 on the Pokemon Showdown doubles ladder. I made this website to write about personal projects and thoughts, so for anything career-related, visit my LinkedIn. If you want to provide feedback, recommend movies, or discuss why the Timberwolves are bad, feel free to contact me on social media or by email.

item.title: Ratings 2019
item.description: Intro Towards the end of 2018, I took a larger interest in films, largely thanks to a few friends who showed me the amount of thought, planning, and technology that goes into crafting a good movie. I figured I might as well document what I’ve seen. My average rating as of June is 7.13. I think that’s reasonable, since I generally choose to watch good movies. Ratings are accompanied by a few paragraphs of my thoughts and are spoiler free, except for drop-down sections labelled as such.

item.title: Portal Mirrors
item.description: Inspiration Placeholder. Planning to make some Portal mirrors to decorate my room once I settle down in California. Inspired by this video.

item.title: Website
item.description: Inspiration I’ve been meaning to make a website for a while. In college, the thought process was to create a digital portfolio to showcase my worth. Now that I’ve graduated and have some time to kill before starting work, it’s mostly just a fun project for self-improvement purposes and to practice writing. I figured I could document all of my hobby projects and share some of my thoughts online rather than letting everything sit on a hard drive, for my eyes only.
